items.name: Step Ladder Safety
items.description: A ladder is an essential workplace tool for anyone working above ground level. However, each year more than half a million people are injured while using ladders.
details: The most common type of accident was when the ladder tipped over sideways. These accidents were caused by reaching out too far to one side, causing an unintentional movement of the ladder. Other causes of stepladder accidents included placing the foot incorrectly, tripping and slipping, defective ladders and makeshift repairs, or failing to fold out the ladder properly.
Here are some safety tips to follow when using a stepladder:

items.name: Ladder Safety Rung By Rung
items.description: If you use a ladder only occasionally, chances are it's a stepladder. Accidents happen just as easily with stepladders as with other types of ladders and scaffolding, and the consequences can be just as serious. In fact, a study of ladder accidents found 20 per cent of the injuries involved stepladders. Of 23 cases studied, 12 persons were injured in leisure time and 11 during working hours.
